alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 10 at 3:10AM PDT until April 11 at 6:00PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory above 2000 feet, additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches above 2000 feet, and 4 to 8 below 2000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM PDT this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to 6 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall expected tonight and Monday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map
